byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Catania.

abstract: European leaders will triple funding for search and rescue missions of smuggled migrant workers in Mediterranean Sea; still, efforts will not make up for cancellation of Italian Naval program Mare Nostrum, which saved thousands of lives while successfully prosecuting smugglers; some criticize response to crisis as insufficient and shortsighted.
lead_paragraph: Europe is struggling with how to save lives on the sea, prosecute human smugglers and deal with the causes of the migrant surge closer to their source.

headline.main: Migration Crisis Puts Europe’s Policy Missteps Into Focus, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Migration Crisis Puts Europe’s Policy Missteps Into Focus, Experts Say

snippet: Europe is struggling with how to save lives on the sea, prosecute human smugglers and deal with the causes of the migrant surge closer to their source.
